page.title: 08Education in Peterborough
page.content: {Education in Peterborough}is the responsibility of Cambridgeshire County Council, administered through their Northern Area Education Office. There are currently 68 Primary and 13 Secondary schools, with a total of almost 30,000 pupils. Every primary school has a catchment area, but secondary admissions are determined by parental preference. Post-16 courses, both academic and vocational are provided at 11 schools and the Technical College. Each school has its own character - some are Community schools sharing facilities with the public; some have specialist units for handicapped pupils. Four schools are part of the TVEI scheme. Support services for teachers include the Multi-Cultural Centre and the Educational Development Centre.
